title: Requires notification of actions of perpetrator of crime in workplace to former employer or
summary: Requires notification of actions of perpetrator of crime in workplace to former employer or workplace.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1817

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 13, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  SAVINO -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Labor

       AN ACT to amend the labor  law,  in  relation  to  preventing  workplace
         violence

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Short title. This act shall be known and may  be  cited  as
    2  "Joanne's law".
    3    S 2. Paragraph a of subdivision 2 of section 27-b of the labor law, as
    4  added by chapter 82 of the laws of 2006, is amended to read as follows:
    5    a. "Employer" means: (1) ANY PRIVATE OR NON-MUNICIPAL INDUSTRY, TRADE,
    6  OCCUPATION  OR PROCESS; (2) the state; [(2)] (3) a political subdivision
    7  of the state, provided, however that this subdivision shall not mean any
    8  employer as defined in section twenty-eight hundred one-a of the  educa-
    9  tion  law;  and  [(3)]  (4)  a public authority, a public benefit corpo-
   10  ration, or any other governmental agency or instrumentality thereof.
   11    S 3. Section 27-b of the labor law is amended by adding a new subdivi-
   12  sion 7 to read as follows:
   13    7. NOTIFICATION OF ACTIONS OF CRIME PERPETRATORS. THE PROPER  AUTHORI-
   14  TIES  HAVING  JURISDICTION  OF  A  PERSON WHO HAS COMMITTED A CRIME IN A
   15  WORKPLACE SHALL NOTIFY THE FORMER EMPLOYER OF SAID PERSON OR  THE  WORK-
   16  PLACE  WHERE  HE  OR  SHE  WAS  EMPLOYED IF SAID PERSON IS RELEASED FROM
   17  INCARCERATION OR HAS VIOLATED THE PROVISIONS OF HIS OR HER PROBATION  OR
   18  PAROLE.  A  WORKPLACE  SHALL  BE  NOTIFIED  ABOVE  ONLY IF THE CRIME WAS
   19  COMMITTED IN THE WORKPLACE AND THE EMPLOYER WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR  NOTIFY-
   20  ING  THE  PROPER  POLICE  AGENCY  OF THE COMMISSION OF SAID CRIME.  THIS
   21  SECTION SHALL APPLY TO THE RELEASE OF OR VIOLATION BY, AS STATED  PREVI-
   22  OUSLY,  AN  EMPLOYEE  OR A VISITOR TO THE WORKPLACE WHERE SAID CRIME WAS
   23  COMMITTED AND SAID PERSON COMMITTED SAID CRIME.
   24    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06915-01-1
